title: borges versalitas
content:
I recently bought this family, not expensive, and find it very, very elegant and readable. The uppercase B, being especially lovely.

What do others think?

John
author: johnland

comments.content: I take it you're referring to [Borges in the Blanca Versalitas weight](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417180330/http:/pampatype.com/php/English/Tipografias_BBV.php?secc=cara&menu=menu_T_C.html&sub1=sub1_T_BBV_C.html&sub2=sub2_T_B_C.html&pag=pag_T_BBV_C.html)? I like it, thought I prefer the darker Gris weight for text. [Alejandro Lo Celso](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417180330/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Alejandro%20Lo%20Celso) is a fine designer and largely undiscovered.

We seem to be entering a Latin Renaissance in type designs lately--foundries in Portugal, Mexico, Argentina especially. I looked at Borges and liked it, but wound up getting the very similar Esta from DSType because it was much better priced.
